title: Reported Speech
description: Слушайте и определяйте смысл косвенной речи.

tasks.audioText: During the press conference, the CEO addressed the shareholders. He said that the company had exceeded its quarterly targets by a significant margin.
tasks.transcript: He said that the company had exceeded its quarterly targets by a significant margin.

options.text: The company performed well below expectations last quarter.
The CEO reported that quarterly results were considerably better than planned.
The CEO announced that the company would set new targets next quarter.
The shareholders told the CEO about the quarterly performance.

tasks.explanation: 'Had exceeded' is the past perfect backshift of 'has exceeded'. The CEO reported strong results surpassing targets.

tasks.audioText: The professor was discussing the research findings with her colleagues. She told them that the experiment had yielded unexpected results that contradicted the original hypothesis.
tasks.transcript: She told them that the experiment had yielded unexpected results that contradicted the original hypothesis.

options.text: The professor informed her colleagues that the experiment's outcomes were surprising and disproved the initial theory.
The colleagues told the professor about the unexpected experiment.
The professor confirmed that the hypothesis was correct.
The experiment had not been completed yet.

tasks.explanation: 'Told them that... had yielded' reports past findings. The results were unexpected and went against the hypothesis.

tasks.audioText: After the diplomatic summit, the spokesperson gave a statement. He explained that both nations had agreed to resume bilateral trade negotiations immediately.
tasks.transcript: He explained that both nations had agreed to resume bilateral trade negotiations immediately.

options.text: The nations refused to participate in any further trade discussions.
Only one nation agreed to the trade negotiations.
The spokesperson reported that the two countries decided to restart trade talks without delay.
The spokesperson asked the nations to begin negotiations.

tasks.explanation: 'Explained that... had agreed' uses past perfect to report an earlier agreement. Both nations committed to immediate resumption.

tasks.audioText: The witness was questioned extensively during the trial. She claimed that she had been at home the entire evening and had not seen anything unusual.
tasks.transcript: She claimed that she had been at home the entire evening and had not seen anything unusual.

options.text: The witness admitted to seeing something suspicious that evening.
The witness stated she was at home all evening and noticed nothing out of the ordinary.
The witness said she had left home briefly during the evening.
The witness was not questioned during the trial.

tasks.explanation: 'Claimed that she had been... and had not seen' reports two past perfect actions. She denied witnessing anything.

tasks.audioText: The manager called an emergency meeting with the development team. He told the engineers that the client had requested a complete redesign of the user interface.
tasks.transcript: He told the engineers that the client had requested a complete redesign of the user interface.

options.text: The engineers told the manager about the client's request.
The client was satisfied with the current user interface design.
The manager informed the team that the client wanted the UI entirely redesigned.
The manager asked the client to redesign the interface.

tasks.explanation: 'Told... that the client had requested' reports the client's earlier demand through the manager. A full UI overhaul was needed.

tasks.audioText: The journalist interviewed the minister after the parliament session. The minister stated that the government would not be raising taxes in the foreseeable future.
tasks.transcript: The minister stated that the government would not be raising taxes in the foreseeable future.

options.text: The minister confirmed that tax increases were planned for next year.
The journalist said that taxes would remain unchanged.
The minister declared that no tax hikes were expected anytime soon.
The government had already raised taxes before the interview.

tasks.explanation: 'Stated that... would not be raising' uses future-in-the-past to report a commitment against tax increases.

tasks.audioText: The doctor reviewed the patient's test results carefully. She told the patient that his cholesterol levels had dropped considerably since the last check-up.
tasks.transcript: She told the patient that his cholesterol levels had dropped considerably since the last check-up.

options.text: The patient's cholesterol had increased significantly.
The doctor reported a notable improvement in the patient's cholesterol readings.
The doctor suggested the patient needed more frequent check-ups.
The patient told the doctor about his cholesterol concerns.

tasks.explanation: 'Told... that his levels had dropped considerably' reports a positive health development using past perfect backshift.

tasks.audioText: The ambassador addressed the United Nations assembly. He said that his country had always been committed to peaceful conflict resolution and would continue to uphold that principle.
tasks.transcript: He said that his country had always been committed to peaceful conflict resolution and would continue to uphold that principle.

options.text: The ambassador declared his nation's ongoing dedication to resolving disputes peacefully.
The ambassador said his country was abandoning its commitment to peace.
The UN asked the ambassador about his country's military plans.
The ambassador reported that other nations should follow his country's example.

tasks.explanation: 'Said that... had always been committed... and would continue' combines past perfect and conditional to express enduring commitment.

tasks.audioText: The author was interviewed on a popular literary podcast. She mentioned that she had drawn inspiration from her grandmother's wartime diaries when writing the novel.
tasks.transcript: She mentioned that she had drawn inspiration from her grandmother's wartime diaries when writing the novel.

options.text: The author wrote entirely fictional stories with no personal connections.
The author's grandmother wrote the novel herself.
The podcast host inspired the author to write.
The author revealed that her grandmother's war journals influenced her book.

tasks.explanation: 'Mentioned that she had drawn inspiration from' reports the source of creative influence using past perfect.

tasks.audioText: The lead scientist held a briefing for the research team. He announced that the laboratory had secured additional funding for the next three years.
tasks.transcript: He announced that the laboratory had secured additional funding for the next three years.

options.text: The laboratory lost its funding for upcoming research.
The scientist informed the team that extra financial support had been obtained for three more years.
The research team asked the scientist to find more funding.
The funding was only guaranteed for one year.

tasks.explanation: 'Announced that... had secured additional funding' reports good news about extended financial backing for the lab.

tasks.audioText: The school principal sent a letter to all parents. She wrote that the school would be implementing a new curriculum starting in September.
tasks.transcript: She wrote that the school would be implementing a new curriculum starting in September.

options.text: The principal informed parents that curriculum changes were coming in September.
The parents asked the principal to change the curriculum.
The new curriculum had already been implemented before the letter.
The school decided to keep the existing curriculum unchanged.

tasks.explanation: 'Wrote that the school would be implementing' uses future-in-the-past to report planned educational changes.

tasks.audioText: The defence lawyer spoke to journalists outside the courthouse. He insisted that his client had not been involved in any fraudulent activity whatsoever.
tasks.transcript: He insisted that his client had not been involved in any fraudulent activity whatsoever.

options.text: The lawyer admitted his client was guilty of fraud.
The journalists claimed the client was innocent.
The lawyer firmly denied any connection between his client and fraud.
The client personally addressed the media about the charges.

tasks.explanation: 'Insisted that... had not been involved' is a strong denial using reported speech with past perfect passive.

tasks.audioText: The airline representative made an announcement at the gate. She apologised and explained that the flight had been delayed due to severe weather conditions over the Atlantic.
tasks.transcript: She apologised and explained that the flight had been delayed due to severe weather conditions over the Atlantic.

options.text: The flight was cancelled permanently because of bad weather.
The representative said sorry and reported that Atlantic storms caused the flight delay.
The passengers complained about the delay before the announcement.
The flight departed on time despite poor weather.

tasks.explanation: 'Apologised and explained that... had been delayed' combines two reporting verbs to convey regret and the reason for delay.

tasks.audioText: The chairman addressed the board members at the annual meeting. He warned them that the competition had intensified dramatically and that the company needed to adapt quickly.
tasks.transcript: He warned them that the competition had intensified dramatically and that the company needed to adapt quickly.

options.text: The chairman praised the board for handling the competition well.
The board warned the chairman about increasing competition.
The chairman cautioned the board that rivals had grown much stronger and rapid adaptation was essential.
The company had already adapted to the competitive market successfully.

tasks.explanation: 'Warned that... had intensified... and that... needed to adapt' reports two clauses: a past development and a present necessity.

tasks.audioText: The detective briefed the chief inspector on the progress of the investigation. He reported that the forensic team had identified two suspects and that further arrests were imminent.
tasks.transcript: He reported that the forensic team had identified two suspects and that further arrests were imminent.

options.text: The investigation had made no progress in identifying suspects.
The chief inspector asked the detective to find more evidence.
Only one suspect had been identified by the forensic team.
The detective informed his superior that two suspects were found and more arrests were expected soon.

tasks.explanation: 'Reported that... had identified two suspects and that further arrests were imminent' conveys progress and anticipated action.

short_description: Косвенная речь с изменением времён и глаголами передачи информации.
